Asset Performance Report
from (human) sensor data:

5-Year Trend, 5 Market Segments

                       Created by: Dong Wang

About this report

Context

We have a set of around 700 at-place counter devices (sensors) located across the country-mostly. It allows a representative sample of the five main types to be reported upon: Cat-1, Cat-2, Cat-3, Cat-4, Cat-5.

Purpose

  1. To improve the quality of utilisation performance measures as required for the Investor Confidence Rating

  2. To inform Company decision making

Market Segments

Cat-1

Cat-2

Cat-3

Cat-4

Cat-5

Cat-1

Figure 1: Yearly counts: the average (mean) and 95% confidence interval estimation over time

Annual human numbers

siteClass Fyear siteNum Mean Upper Lower
Cat-1 2013/14 74 2697 3514 1880
Cat-1 2014/15 74 2943 3939 1947
Cat-1 2015/16 74 3370 4443 2297
Cat-1 2016/17 74 3458 4508 2408
Cat-1 2017/18 74 3179 4267 2092
Notes:

  • siteNum: Number of counters included in reporting
  • Mean: the averaged count recorded across counters
  • Upper and Lower: upper and lower bound of 95% confidence intervals estimated for the mean

Data Quality

Notes:

  • This report only includes counters which have valid records from 2013-07-01 00:00:00 to 2018-06-30 23:00:00
  • 95% Upper and Lower confidence intervals are good estimations only when siteNum: Number of counters included in reporting is large enough (>50)

This report uses uncalibrated counter data; i.e. the number of times the counter sensor has been triggered by a person. Uncalibrated counter data must not be used to indicate the number huamns to a place.
